alert.note: Alert for Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Butte, Blackfoot Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 10 at 6:26PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Intense snow showers will impact portions of southeastern Missoula, northwestern Granite, north central Ravalli and western Powell Counties through 715 PM MST... At 625 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking intense snow showers along a line extending from near Missoula to near Stevensville. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Visibility one-half mile or less and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility could result in dangerous driving conditions. Locations impacted include... Missoula, Lolo, Stevensville, Bonner-West Riverside, East Missoula, Florence, Nimrod, Potomac, Bearmouth, Quigley, Clinton, Turah and Garnet. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 103 and 144. Highway 93 S between mile markers 65 and 84, and between mile markers 87 and 94. Highway 200 E between mile markers 0 and 5, and between mile markers 13 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
